title: T}alk{S}umm: A Dataset and Scalable Annotation Method for Scientific Paper Summarization Based on Conference Talks
authors:
Lev, Guy  and
Shmueli-Scheuer, Michal  and
Herzig, Jonathan  and
Jerbi, Achiya  and
Konopnicki, David
venue: Proceedings of the 57th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics
abstract: Currently, no large-scale training data is available for the task of scientific paper summarization. In this paper, we propose a novel method that automatically generates summaries for scientific papers, by utilizing videos of talks at scientific conferences. We hypothesize that such talks constitute a coherent and concise description of the papersâ€™ content, and can form the basis for good summaries. We collected 1716 papers and their corresponding videos, and created a dataset of paper summaries. A model trained on this dataset achieves similar performance as models trained on a dataset of summaries created manually. In addition, we validated the quality of our summaries by human experts.
